title.narrative: Support institutional capacity-building of the Governments of Thailand and Mongolia for the design of a policy framework to improve national productivity

description.narrative: Currently, Thailand is being stuck in the #middle income trap# due to a lack of labor force and capital required to convert into high value-added industries. The per-capita GDP in Thailand after reaching its peak in 2013 is now gradually declining. Particularly, as this country enters an aging society, it suffers from a lack of labor, which leads to reduction in productivity. The government of Thailand has put its utmost efforts into developing industrial development policies that stimulate SMEs' productivity and promote innovation. Although rising as a middle-income country, Mongolia which has typical resource-based industrial structure also suffers from gradual decline of the growth potential in recent years due to the drop in international resource prices, reduction in domestic and international demand. The Mongolian government recognizes that it is urgent to diversify industrial structure and establish a manufacturing base through the development of SMEs in order to achieve sustainable growth. To this end, the government formulated and initiates the #national industrial policy# based on several objectives in June 2015: avoidance of the industrial structure which is dependent on mining resources and agriculture, development of the manufacturing industry and industrial diversification.
